Package com.kneelawk.graphlib.debugrender.api.client.render

Interface BlockNodeDebugRenderer<N extends DebugBlockNode>

Type Parameters:
N - the specific type of client block node that this renderer handles.
public interface BlockNodeDebugRenderer<N extends DebugBlockNode>
Handles rendering a DebugBlockNode.

  • Method Details

    • render

      void render(@NotNull N node, @NotNull @NotNull com.kneelawk.graphlib.api.util.graph.Node<ClientBlockNodeHolder,com.kneelawk.graphlib.api.util.EmptyLinkKey> holderNode, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.client.render.VertexConsumerProvider consumers, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.client.util.math.MatrixStack stack, @NotNull @NotNull DebugBlockGraph graph, @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.util.math.Vec3d endpoint, int graphColor)
      Renders the client block node.

      The provided matrix is already translated for rendering relative to the block node's block position.

      Parameters:
      node - the client block node to render.
      holderNode - the graph-node of the current node, for ease of checking connections and block position.
      consumers - the vertex consumers to render to.
      stack - the matrix stack containing relevant transformations for rendering at the correct position.
      graph - the graph that the node belongs to.
      endpoint - the position returned by getLineEndpoint(DebugBlockNode, Node, DebugBlockGraph, int, int, List).
      graphColor - the color that this graph has been assigned.

    • getLineEndpoint

      @NotNull @NotNull net.minecraft.util.math.Vec3d getLineEndpoint(@NotNull N node, @NotNull @NotNull com.kneelawk.graphlib.api.util.graph.Node<ClientBlockNodeHolder,com.kneelawk.graphlib.api.util.EmptyLinkKey> holderNode, @NotNull @NotNull DebugBlockGraph graph, int nodesAtPos, int indexAmongNodes, @NotNull @NotNull List<net.minecraft.util.math.Vec3d> otherEndpoints)
      Gets the point where lines connecting to the given node should be shown connecting to.

      This is relative to the node's block position.

      Parameters:
      node - the node that the lines are connecting to.
      holderNode - the graph node of the current node, for ease of checking connections and block position.
      graph - the graph that the node belongs to.
      nodesAtPos - the number of nodes also sharing the same BlockPos or SidedPos.
      indexAmongNodes - the index of this node in the set of nodes being rendered at this position.
      otherEndpoints - a list of all the locations previous nodes at the same position have set as their endpoints.
      Returns:
      the position, relative to the node's block position, that lines should be drawn to.
